citeinfo.title: North Pacific and Bering Sea Oceanography, 1959

descript.abstract:
This report presents oceanographic data collected at fishing stations in the North Pacific and the Bering Sea from May to September 1959, as a part of the research conducted by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service under the direction of the United States Section of the International North Pacific Fisheries Commission. The also describes procedures and shows stations occupied by the fishing vessels "Tordenskjold", and "Pioneer". The tabulated data show temperature and values of salinity density dissolved oxygen and dissolved inorganic phosphate at varying depths to 1050 meters, numbers, time and position of drift bottle release; time position and weather and sea conditions for bathythermograph lowerings; and displacement volumes, wet weights and numbers of organisms per cubic meter of water for the vertical 1/2 meter plankton hauls.
[Reference: Favorite, F. and G.M. Pedersen. North Pacific and Bering Sea Oceanography, 1957. U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service Special Scientific Report - Fisheries No. 377. 1959. 212 p.]
descript.purpose: To report on oceanographic data collected at fishing stations in the North Pacific and the Bering Sea.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
